page.title: 11Farming
page.content: Farming in this area has now become highly mechanised, with a small skilled workforce. Farms have become larger units specialising in the pro_ duction of cereals, soft and hard fruit, sheep, pigs and dairy cattle. Fields are larger to accommodate the machines used. Apples and pears are grown on smaller trees and when picked cold stored until graded, packed and sent to market. Blackcurrants are machine picked and contracted to juice producers. Grass has become a managed crop for both silage and hay. Sheep graze the rough grassland. Dairy herds are kept inside for much of the year in deep strawyards and houses, with summer grazing only. Pigs are kept in intensive rearing units. Farms are still family concerns but run on very efficient business lines with attent_ ion paid to the profit margins.
